text:
Question 82) In an experiment, a teacher took to the classroom a bag of rice, a piece of triangular wood and a cylindrical and homogeneous iron bar. He proposed to measure the mass of the bar using these objects. To this end, the students made markings in the bar, dividing it into eight equal parts, and then supported it on the triangular base, with the rice bag hanging at one end, until it reaches the equilibrium situation.
Rice 5.00 kg In this situation, what was the mass of the bar obtained by the students?
A) 3.00 kg
B) 3.75 kg
C) 5.00 kg
D) 6.00 kg
E) 15.00 kg
